titleStmt.title: [ward D bed 50 Armory]
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. notesStmt.note: No image of verso currently available.

Whitman's note suggests that this manuscript was composed in July 1863. The earliest possible date for this manuscript is mid-June 1863. Union soldier George W. Monk was wounded at the battle of Chancellorsville on May 3, 1863. He was sent to Armory Square hospital on June 15, 1863, where he remained at least until he was furloughed on August 27, 1863 ("Corporal George W. Monk," The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion (1861—65) [Washington: Government Printing Office, 1870], 1.2:229).
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Ashley Lawson Tim Jackson
